CatDescriptText: Meda Wardley, 2141 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that there would be less. I think that all fathers should be the heads of their homes and should give the advice to their children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Meda Wardley wearing dark button down coat with geometric pattern and up turned cuffs and dark knit hat with light colored dots, holding eyeglasses, envelope, and dark handbag, standing on sidewalk in front of store window displaying kitchen appliances, window shoppers in background
